org.cyclops.commoncapabilities.api.capability.wrench

Interface IWrench

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultWrench

    public interface IWrench
    Indicates that something can be used as wrench. This must be used by targets (like blocks or entities) to determine if the thing that activated them is a wrench. The target is responsible for checking if the wrench can be used for this target using canUse(PlayerEntity, WrenchTarget). If it can be used, the target must first call beforeUse(PlayerEntity, WrenchTarget). After that the target can call its own logic. Finally, the target must call afterUse(PlayerEntity, WrenchTarget).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Called before the wrench is being used after the canUse check if done.
      boolean canUse(net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity player, WrenchTarget target)
      Check if this wrench can be used.

    • Method Detail

      • canUse

        boolean canUse(net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity player,
               WrenchTarget target)
        Check if this wrench can be used.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        target - The target that is being wrenched.
        Returns:
        If it can be used.

      • beforeUse

        void beforeUse(net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity player,
               WrenchTarget target)
        Called before the wrench is being used after the canUse check if done. Useful for preparing some things for the wrench-action.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        target - The target that is being wrenched.

      • afterUse

        void afterUse(net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity player,
              WrenchTarget target)
        Called after the wrench is used. Useful for doing cleanup work, or consuming energy.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        target - The target that is being wrenched.
